title: Elder, Eldest, Older, Oldest | Grammar Exercise

questions.question: My …………….. sister took care of me after the death of our mother.
questions.description: Oldest and eldest are both possible here.

questions.question: She is two years …………….. than her husband.
questions.description: Elder and eldest can only be used in the attributive position.

questions.question: I have two …………….. sisters.
questions.description: Both elder and older are possible in attributive position with similar meanings.

questions.question: I am the ……………. in my family.
He is the ……………… man in the village.
questions.description: Elder and eldest are only used to talk about relationships within a family.

questions.question: My ………………. brother is turning sixty next week.
questions.description: Older and oldest are used in the same way as elder and eldest.

questions.question: He is the …………………. of the four brothers.
The Cathedral is by far the ………………. building in the town.
questions.description: We can use older and oldest to refer to the age of things.

questions.question: I think my grandmother is ………………. than your grandmother.
questions.description: Elder and eldest can only be used in the attributive position.

questions.question: I think she is a couple of years ……………..
questions.description: Elder and eldest cannot be used in the predicative position.

questions.question: Samuel is the ……………….. member of the club.
questions.description: Elder and eldest are only used to talk about relationships within a family.

questions.question: I think he is …………….. than me.
questions.description: Elder cannot be used in the attributive position.
